location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:70 x 95 mmCondition:The image is in good condition.Foliation:'b'; '32'Process:Silver gelatin print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:View near Bushire of an Imamzada [Imamzadeh], or shrine-tomb for the descendant of an Imam, directly related to the Prophet Muhammad. It is unclear which of various shrine-tombs in the area this image depicts. The dome of the shrine-tomb is visible right of centre in the background. The foreground and middle-ground are taken up with an area of palm and other trees. At left part of a stone-built wall is visible.Inscriptions:Lower left, below image, in pen: ‘Bushire.’Upper left, above image, in pencil, crossed-out: ‘b’Lower right, alongside image, in pencil: ‘32’Lower right, below image, in pen: ‘Imamzada.’, ‘(Feb. 1918)’
